title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.54 | 1-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Real yoga practice means, to focus or concentrate one's attention on the supreme Lord who is seated in everyone's heart.
segments.summary: This segment explains the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam about controlling senses through Ashtanga Yoga to become immune to material contaminations, emphasizing the importance of focusing on the Supreme Lord within the heart and distinguishing between the individual soul and the Paramatma.

segments.key_quote: Engaging the senses in the service of the Lord means we become very easily focused on the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the role of Paramatma as the witness and sanctioner of desires, contrasting the indirect approach of Ashtanga Yoga with the direct engagement of senses in Bhakti Yoga, highlighting the effectiveness and power of the latter.

segments.key_quote: Even the highest mode, the material mode of goodness, is also a cause of material bondage.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes that directly engaging the senses in the service of the Lord purifies one from material contaminations, even the mode of goodness, and contrasts this with the bondage caused by passion and ignorance, which fuel lust and greed, leading to an insatiable desire for wealth and power.

segments.key_quote: When the heart becomes free from this lust and greed, that is a big step towards purification.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how lust and greed lead to a loss of intelligence and discrimination, emphasizing that overcoming these base mentalities is a significant step towards purification, ultimately leading to goodness, which, while not complete freedom, allows one to control the senses and surrender to the Supreme Lord through Bhakti Yoga.
